# Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version (opens new window) for commit guidelines.

# 7.1.0 (opens new window) (2017-04-13)

# Bug Fixes

  • fix demandOption no longer treats 'false' as truthy (#829 (opens new window)) (c748dd2 (opens new window))
  • get terminalWidth in non interactive mode no longer causes a validation exception (#837 (opens new window)) (360e301 (opens new window))
  • we shouldn't output help if we've printed a prior help-like message (#847 (opens new window)) (17e89bd (opens new window))

# Features

  • add support for numeric commands (#825 (opens new window)) (fde0564 (opens new window))

# 7.1.2 (opens new window) (2021-04-25)

# Bug Fixes

  • deps: explicitly bump yargs-parser (#1887 (opens new window)) (06db5fc (opens new window))

# 7.0.2 (opens new window) (2017-03-10)

# Bug Fixes

  • populating placeholder arguments broke validation (b3eb2fe (opens new window))

# 7.0.1 (opens new window) (2017-03-03)

# Bug Fixes

  • --help with default command should print top-level help (#810 (opens new window)) (9c03fa4 (opens new window))

# 7.0.0 (opens new window) (2017-02-26)

# Bug Fixes

  • address min/max validation message regression (#750 (opens new window)) (2e5ce0f (opens new window))
  • address positional argument strict() bug introduced in #766 (opens new window) (#784 (opens new window)) (a8528e6 (opens new window))
  • console.warn() rather than throwing errors when api signatures are incorrect (#804 (opens new window)) (a607061 (opens new window))
  • context should override parsed argv (#786 (opens new window)) (0997288 (opens new window))
  • context variables are now recognized in strict() mode (#796 (opens new window)) (48575cd (opens new window))
  • errors were not bubbling appropriately from sub-commands to top-level (#802 (opens new window)) (8a992f5 (opens new window))
  • positional arguments of sub-commands threw strict() exception (#805 (opens new window)) (f3f074b (opens new window))
  • pull in yargs-parser with modified env precedence (#787 (opens new window)) (e0fbbe5 (opens new window))
  • running parse() multiple times on the same yargs instance caused exception if help() enabled (#790 (opens new window)) (07e39b7 (opens new window))
  • use path.resolve() to support node 0.10 (#797 (opens new window)) (49a93fc (opens new window))

# Features

  • add conflicts and implies shorthands. (#753 (opens new window)) (bd1472b (opens new window))
  • add traditional Chinese translation (#780 (opens new window)) (6ab6a95 (opens new window))
  • allow provided config object to extend other configs (#779 (opens new window)) (3280dd0 (opens new window))
  • function argument validation (#773 (opens new window)) (22ed9bb (opens new window))
  • if only one column is provided for examples, allow it to take up the entire line (#749 (opens new window)) (7931652 (opens new window))
  • introduce custom yargs error object (#765 (opens new window)) (8308efa (opens new window))
  • introduces support for default commands, using the '*' identifier (#785 (opens new window)) (d78a0f5 (opens new window))
  • rethink how options are inherited by commands (#766 (opens new window)) (ab1fa4b (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • extends key in config file is now used for extending other config files
  • environment variables now take precedence over config files.
  • context now takes precedence over argv and defaults
  • the arguments passed to functions are now validated, there's a good chance this will throw exceptions for a few folks who are using the API in an unexpected way.
  • by default options, and many of yargs' parsing helpers will now default to being applied globally; such that they are no-longer reset before being passed into commands.
  • yargs will no longer aggressively suppress errors, allowing errors that are not generated internally to bubble.

# 6.6.0 (opens new window) (2016-12-29)

# Bug Fixes

  • [object Object] was accidentally being populated on options object (#736 (opens new window)) (f755e27 (opens new window))
  • do not use cwd when resolving package.json for yargs parsing config (#726 (opens new window)) (9bdaab7 (opens new window))

# Features

  • implement conflicts() for defining mutually exclusive arguments; thanks @madcampos (opens new window)! (#741 (opens new window)) (5883779 (opens new window))
  • split demand() into demandCommand()/demandOption() (#740 (opens new window)) (66573c8 (opens new window))
  • support for positional argument aliases (#727 (opens new window)) (27e1a57 (opens new window))

# 6.5.0 (opens new window) (2016-12-01)

# Bug Fixes

  • still freeze/unfreeze if parse() is called in isolation (#717 (opens new window)) (30a9492 (opens new window))

# Features

  • pull in yargs-parser introducing additional settings (#688 (opens new window)), and fixing #716 (opens new window) (#722 (opens new window)) (702995a (opens new window))

# 6.4.0 (opens new window) (2016-11-13)

# Bug Fixes

  • locales: correct some Russian translations (#691 (opens new window)) (a980671 (opens new window))

# Features

  • locales: Added Belarusian translation (#690 (opens new window)) (68dac1f (opens new window))
  • locales: Create nl.json (#687 (opens new window)) (46ce1bb (opens new window))
  • update to yargs-parser that addresses #598 (opens new window), #617 (opens new window) (#700 (opens new window)) (54cb31d (opens new window))
  • yargs is now passed as the third-argument to fail handler (#613 (opens new window)) (21b74f9 (opens new window))

# Performance Improvements

  • normalizing package data is an expensive operation (#705 (opens new window)) (49cf533 (opens new window))

# 6.3.0 (opens new window) (2016-10-19)

# Bug Fixes

  • command: subcommands via commandDir() now supported for parse(msg, cb) (#678 (opens new window)) (6b85cc6 (opens new window))

# Features

  • locales: Add Thai locale file (#679 (opens new window)) (c05e36b (opens new window))

# 6.2.0 (opens new window) (2016-10-16)

# Bug Fixes

  • stop applying parser to context object (#675 (opens new window)) (3fe9b8f (opens new window))

# Features

  • add new pt_BR translations (#674 (opens new window)) (5615a82 (opens new window))
  • Italian translations for 'did you mean' and 'aliases' (#673 (opens new window)) (81984e6 (opens new window))

# 6.1.1 (opens new window) (2016-10-15)

# Bug Fixes

  • freeze was not resetting configObjects to initial state; addressed performance issue raised by @nexdrew (opens new window). (#670 (opens new window)) (ae4bcd4 (opens new window))

# 6.1.0 (opens new window) (2016-10-15)

# Bug Fixes

  • locales: change some translations (#667 (opens new window)) (aa966c5 (opens new window))
  • locales: conform hi locale to y18n.__n expectations (#666 (opens new window)) (22adb18 (opens new window))

# Features

  • initial support for command aliases (#647 (opens new window)) (127a040 (opens new window))
  • command: add camelcase commands to argv (#658 (opens new window)) (b1cabae (opens new window))
  • locales: add Hindi translations (9290912 (opens new window))
  • locales: add Hungarian translations (be92327 (opens new window))
  • locales: Japanese translations for 'did you mean' and 'aliases' (#651 (opens new window)) (5eb78fc (opens new window))
  • locales: Polish translations for 'did you mean' and 'aliases' (#650 (opens new window)) (c951c0e (opens new window))
  • reworking yargs API to make it easier to run in headless environments, e.g., Slack (#646 (opens new window)) (f284c29 (opens new window))
  • Turkish translations for 'did you mean' and 'aliases' (#660 (opens new window)) (072fd45 (opens new window))

# 6.0.0 (opens new window) (2016-09-30)

# Bug Fixes

  • changed parsing of the command string to ignore extra spaces (#600 (opens new window)) (e8e5a72 (opens new window))
  • drop lodash.assign (#641 (opens new window)) (ad3146f (opens new window))
  • for args that have skipValidation set to true, check if the parsed arg is true (#619 (opens new window)) (658a34c (opens new window))
  • upgrade standard, and fix appveyor config so that it works with newest standard (#607 (opens new window)) (c301f42 (opens new window))

# Chores

  • upgrade yargs-parser (#633 (opens new window)) (cc1224e (opens new window))

# Features

  • make opts object optional for .option() (#624 (opens new window)) (4f29de6 (opens new window))

# Performance Improvements

  • defer windowWidth() to improve perf for non-help usage (#610 (opens new window)) (cbc3636 (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • coerce is now applied as a final step after other parsing is complete

# 5.0.0 (opens new window) (2016-08-14)

# Bug Fixes

  • default: Remove undocumented alias of default() (#469 (opens new window)) (b8591b2 (opens new window))
  • remove deprecated zh.json (#578 (opens new window)) (317c62c (opens new window))

# Features

  • .help() API can now enable implicit help command (#574 (opens new window)) (7645019 (opens new window))
  • command: builder function no longer needs to return the yargs instance (#549 (opens new window)) (eaa2873 (opens new window))
  • add coerce api (#586 (opens new window)) (1d53ccb (opens new window))
  • adds recommendCommands() for command suggestions (#580 (opens new window)) (59474dc (opens new window))
  • apply .env() globally (#553 (opens new window)) (be65728 (opens new window))
  • apply default builder to command() and apply fail() handlers globally (#583 (opens new window)) (0aaa68b (opens new window))
  • update yargs-parser to version 3.1.0 (#581 (opens new window)) (882a127 (opens new window))

# Performance Improvements

  • defer requiring most external libs until needed (#584 (opens new window)) (f9b0ed4 (opens new window))

# BREAKING CHANGES

  • fail is now applied globally.
  • we now default to an empty builder function when command is executed with no builder.
  • yargs-parser now better handles negative integer values, at the cost of handling numeric option names, e.g., -1 hello
  • default: removed undocumented defaults alias for default.
  • introduces a default help command which outputs help, as an alternative to a help flag.
  • interpret demand() numbers as relative to executing command (#582 (opens new window)) (927810c (opens new window))

# 4.8.1 (opens new window) (2016-07-16)

# Bug Fixes

  • commandDir: make dir relative to caller instead of require.main.filename (#548 (opens new window)) (3c2e479 (opens new window))
  • add config lookup for .implies() (#556 (opens new window)) (8d7585c (opens new window))
  • cache pkg lookups by path to avoid returning the wrong one (#552 (opens new window)) (fea7e0b (opens new window))
  • positional arguments were not being handled appropriately by parse() (#559 (opens new window)) (063a866 (opens new window))
  • pull in @nexdrew (opens new window)'s fixes to yargs-parser (#560 (opens new window)) (c77c080 (opens new window)), closes #560 (opens new window)

# 4.8.0 (opens new window) (2016-07-09)

# Bug Fixes

  • drop unused camelcase dependency fixes #516 (opens new window) (#525 (opens new window)) (365fb9a (opens new window)), closes #516 (opens new window) #525 (opens new window)
  • fake a tty in tests, so that we can use the new set-blocking (#512 (opens new window)) (a54c742 (opens new window))
  • ignore invalid package.json during read-pkg-up (#546 (opens new window)) (e058c87 (opens new window))
  • keep both zh and zh_CN until yargs@5 (opens new window).x (0f8faa7 (opens new window))
  • lazy-load package.json and cache. get rid of pkg-conf dependency. (#544 (opens new window)) (2609b2e (opens new window))
  • we now respect the order of _ when applying commands (#537 (opens new window)) (ed86b78 (opens new window))

# Features

  • add .commandDir(dir) to API to apply all command modules from a relative directory (#494 (opens new window)) (b299dff (opens new window))
  • command: derive missing command string from module filename (#527 (opens new window)) (20d4b8a (opens new window))
  • builder is now optional for a command module (#545 (opens new window)) (8d6ad6e (opens new window))

# 4.7.1 (opens new window) (2016-05-15)

# Bug Fixes

  • switch to using const rather than var (#499 (opens new window))
  • make stdout flush on newer versions of Node.js (#501 (opens new window)) (9f8c6f4 (opens new window))

# 4.7.0 (opens new window) (2016-05-02)

# Bug Fixes

  • pkgConf: fix aliases issues in .pkgConf() (#478 (opens new window))(b900502 (opens new window))

# Features

  • completion: allow to get completions for any string, not just process.argv (#470 (opens new window))(74fcfbc (opens new window))
  • configuration: Allow to directly pass a configuration object to .config() (#480 (opens new window))(e0a7e05 (opens new window))
  • validation: Add .skipValidation() method (#471 (opens new window))(d72badb (opens new window))

# 4.6.0 (opens new window) (2016-04-11)

# Bug Fixes

  • my brand!: I agree with @osher (opens new window) lightweight isn't a huge selling point of ours any longer, see #468 (opens new window) (c46d7e1 (opens new window))

# Features

  • switch to standard-version for release management (f70f801 (opens new window))
  • upgrade to version of yargs-parser that introduces some slick new features, great work @elas7 (opens new window). update cliui, replace win-spawn, replace badge. (#475 (opens new window)) (f915dd4 (opens new window))

# 4.5.0 (opens new window) (2016-04-05)

# Bug Fixes

  • windows: handle $0 better on Windows platforms (eb6e03f (opens new window))

# Features

  • commands: implemented variadic positional arguments (51d926e (opens new window))
  • completion: completion now better handles aliases, and avoids duplicating keys. (86416c8 (opens new window))
  • config: If invoking .config() without parameters, set a default option (0413dd1 (opens new window))
  • conventional-changelog: switching to using conventional-changelog for generating the changelog (a2b5a2a (opens new window))

# v4.4.0 (2016/04/03 21:10 +07:00)

# v4.2.0 (2016/2/22 11:02 +07:00)

  • #395 (opens new window) do not reset groups if they contain global keys (@novemberborn)
  • #393 (opens new window) use sane default for usage strings (@nexdrew)
  • #392 (opens new window) resetting wrap() was causing layout issues with commands (@nexdrew)

# v4.0.0 (2016/2/14 1:27 +07:00)

  • #384 (opens new window) add new number type to yargs (@lrlna, @maxrimue)
  • #382 (opens new window) pass error as extra parameter to fail (@gajus)
  • #378 (opens new window) introduces the pkgConf feature, which tells yargs to load default argument values from a key on a project's package.json (@bcoe)
  • #376 (opens new window) breaking change, make help() method signature more consistent with other commands (@maxrimue)
  • #368 (opens new window) breaking change, overhaul to command handling API: introducing named positional arguments, commands as modules, introduces the concept of global options (options that don't reset). (@nexdrew, @bcoe).
  • #364 (opens new window) add the slick new yargs website to the package.json (@iarna).
  • #357 (opens new window) .strict() now requires that a valid command is provided (@lrlna)
  • #356 (opens new window) pull the parsing bits of yargs into the separate module yargs-parser. Various parsing options can now be turned on and off using configuration (@bcoe).
  • #330 (opens new window) breaking change, fix inconsistencies with .version() API. (@maxrimue).

# v3.5.4 (2015/03/12 05:56 +00:00)

  • c16cc08 (opens new window) message for non-option arguments is now optional, thanks to (@raine)
